Description:
Lead of Transportation and Installation Engineering (Pipelines / Cables)Key Job Accountabilities:As T&I Engineering Lead, provide full function T&I engineering to EPC teams to ensure each of the EPC meet objectives - including all aspects of T&I engineering, marine warranty requirements, procedural compliance, execution safety and integrity and project execution effectiveness and efficiency.
Provide core technical and execution expertise to ensure consistent and quality application of T&I systems, processes, and procedures for T&I engineering scope.
Provide demonstrable competency and experience to advise, make recommendations and decisions for T&I regarding transportation and installation engineering requirements and activities including load-out, sea fastening, transportation, heavy lift, float-over, pipelay and cable lay installation analysis, methods and procedures.
Provide knowledge and experienced technical and execution input to engineering designs and installation procedures
Support the delivery of all Transport and Installation Engineering scope based on Contractor installation vessels and barges in accordance with agreed schedule and budget.
Review of transportation and installation procedures from engineering perspective such as heavy lifts, jacket launches, topside floatovers, pipeline, cable, umbilical, crossings, post installed risers including stalk ons, freespan correction, pilling, load out, float on, float off, trenching, burial, beach pull, transpooling and othersSkills
Skills:
QualificationsPreferred Engineering Degree or relevant on the job experience
Extensive project engineering experience in a senior role
Required to have offshore survival certificate and be able to pass an offshore medical evaluation.
OPITO certification is considered a plus.

Knowledge and/or Experience:Recommended 15+ years of experience with at least 10 years demonstrated T&I engineering experience
Experience in multiple T&I engineering aspects including offshore heavy lifts, float-over, pipeline, and cable installations, load-out and transportation; with float-over installation engineering and execution experience considered an advantage
Proficiency in using various installation analysis software such as Moses, Gmoor, Mars, Sacs, Staad, Offpipe, Orcaflex and others
Worldwide experience with contractors in particular those involved in the Offshore projects
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a focus on teamwork and the ability to communicate and interact within a PMT
Application and in-depth knowledge of stakeholder specifications and a working knowledge of Industry standards

Technical and Business Skills:A high level of proficiency in written and spoken English
Computer literacy involving the regular use of professional office applications and some technical applications
Ability to work on or be based on a platform or vessel
